revised_title: In Memoriam: Fellows and Foreign Members of the Royal Society
tldr: The President of the Royal Society, Sir William Huggins, delivers an address at the anniversary meeting, mourning the loss of twelve Fellows and four Foreign Members who passed away during the past year. The address highlights the contributions and achievements of the deceased, including Dr. W. T. Blanford, G. B. Buckton, and Sir William Wharton, among others.
